Package theisland

Class Animal

java.lang.Object
theisland.Animal
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Animal>, Entity
Direct Known Subclasses:
Amphibian, Bird, Fish, Insect, Mammal
public class Animal extends Object implements Entity, Comparable<Animal>
Super class for all animals that sets their common attributes and methods common to them Parameters are name-animal name symbol-character symbol to appear on output x,y-position on the island hungerLevel,thirstLevel-0 to 10,10 full and not thirsty 1 animal dying of thirst or hunger size-creature size from 1 to10,10 being the biggest.e.g.crocodile Boolean canFly-if the animal can fly,input true or false.e.g.Kiwi can not fly so return false
Version:
1.0
Author:
Liang Zhao

    • checkGeographicFeature

      public void checkGeographicFeature​(int direction, Island island)
      check is there an GeographicFeature generate new random direction and move the animals generate random number to move animals check if there is no GeographicFeature move the animal in the same direction
      Parameters:
      direction - -animal moving direction
      island - -animal moving location

    • isNextGeographicFeature

      public boolean isNextGeographicFeature​(int direction, Island island)
      gets next position of the GeographicFeature

      check whether there is an GeographicFeature in the island next position before moving the animal into that position

      Parameters:
      direction - - 1=north 2=east 3=south 4=west
      island - - the location of GeographicFeature
      Returns:
      GeographicFeature's direction

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Animal o)
      sorts out animals based on hunger level e.g. it will first compare animal1 and animal2 since animal1>animal2 it will move animal2 to first position until the end result will be from lowest to highest
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Animal>
